result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark F. Spietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:54 PM Defendant Mark F. Spietz in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Motion to modify probation. Petit statement to attempts made by Defendant concerning sentence/probation/medical issues. Petit asks for modification to sentence for community service in lieu of jail time. Sowinski statement/objection to modification. Petit states he could provided more information if necessary on medical diagnosis. Court statement to Oneida County Jail transfer/sentence. Court denies modification and must serve his 30 days jail. Court states Petit could submit additional medical information for consideration. adj. 02:16 PM

10:01 a.m. Defendant Mark F. Spietz in court with attorney Greg A Petit appearing telephonically with leave of Court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC agent Ashley Caelwaerts appearing telephonically with leave of Court. Court finds if appeal is successful, new trial may be ordered. If appeal is unsuccessful, some amount of jail time will need to be served. Petit/Court/Schiek/Caelwaerts statement. Court extends probation for a 3-month period beyond April 27, 2018 discharge date to allow defendant to serve jail in Outgamie County and to retain jurisdiction of matter. Defendant, defense counsel and DOC agent may appear by telephone. Court suggests JOC be amended to reflect 21 month probation period. Petit statement to DOC Petition and Stipulation form. Court will accept DOC forms to extend probation. Adj. 10:17 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2018 at 11:30 am.

2:11 p.m. Defendant Mark F. Spietz in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petit calls Attorney Bennett/sworn - Defendant waives any confidentiality issues with Attorney Bennett - Court finds waiver free and voluntary. Petit direct/ Exhibit 1-3 marked (police report, motion for return of seized items, order returning defendant's property)/continued direct by Petit - Petit moves to receive Exhibits 1-3 - Schiek has no objections - Received. Continued direct by Petit. Cross by Schiek. Redirect by Petit. Petit calls defendant, Mark F. Spietz/sworn/direct by Petit/Exhibits 4 and 5 marked (transcript of voice mail message; call log of cell phone)/continued direct by Petit - Petit moves to receive Exhibits 4 and 5 - Exhibit 6 marked (DVD of voice mail) - Schiek has no objections - Court receives Exhibits 4, 5 and 6. Cross by Schiek. Exhibit 7 marked (work order dated September 1, 2015). Continued cross by Schiek. Redirect by Petit. Schiek moves to admit Exhibit 7 - Petit no objection - Court receives. Petit/Schiek statement to motion. Petit rebuttal. Court finds as to issue of new evidence - no dispute Ex 4 & 5 were obtained after conviction; no dispute that Tru Assets did not give authorization to collect personal property;  Ex 4 - not clear what date message was left. Court finds defense has met burden of establishing that new evidence exists but does not change what outcome of trial would have been and the interest of justice does not require granting new trial - denies motion. Petit to provide written Order. Petit questions stay of jail time - Court states if appeal is timely filed, stay of jail is continued. If no intent to file appeal then Defense is to provide written notification to court and defendant needs to report to jail 30 days after date of written notification to Court. If no notice of appeal is filed and court is not otherwise informed, defendant needs to report 30 days after expiration of time limit to file appeal. Adj. 3:14 p.m.

4:04 p.m. Defendant Spietz and Attorney Greg A Petit appear by phone with leave of court. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petit speaks to motion for release--requests GPS Outagamie County or Huber release in Waupaca. Schiek statement--no objection to additional time; objects to GPS in Outagamie County. Court statement--references s. 969.01(2)(c); has reviewed sentencing transcript; will not interfere with Sheriff rules; addresses electronic monitoring/Sheriff authority. Court grants stay pending appeal. Petit statement--will be asking for extension for notice of appeal and/or filing postconviction motion. 9/25/17 RH--postconviction motion filed or Petit to file status letter/no appearance necessary by Petit. Court notes Defendant is free to start serving condition jail time if arrangements can be made in another county. Petit to file written order. 4:20 p.m. adj. 4:08 p.m. back on record, all parties present. Agreed by counsel and the court, trial to continue into tomorrow. Bennett statement to prior side bar regarding exhibits. Court statement-speaks to location of evidence, value of property. 4:12 p.m. jury present. Court addresses the jury--advised trial will continue into tomorrow. 4:13 p.m. Bennett cross examination of Captain Terri Hook. Redirect by Schiek. Schiek moves for admission of all exhibits; State rests. Court receives all exhibits. 4:51 p.m. jurors excused/told to return by 8:25 a.m. tomorrow/Court instructs jurors not to discuss case. 4:51 - jurors have left the courtroom. Court statement. Bennett statement--moves court for directed verdict/lack of evidence by the State. Schiek response/speaks to intent. Court statement--denies motion for directed verdict; finds sufficient evidence in record to proceed with jury. Court speaks to jury instructions. Schiek/Bennett statement. Court references 770 Instruction. Instruction conference tomorrow. Counsel in chambers at 8:15 a.m. tomorrow. 5:06 p.m. adjourned.

10:56 a.m. Defendant Mark F. Spietz in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Bennett motion to return of property - Court states that Petition should be filed for return of property. Adj. 11:02 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
